title: Subdataset handling in v7 adjusted branch?

labels.name: adjusted-branches
labels.description: Issues caused by or affected adjusted branch operation

body:
Consumption seems to be fine already:

Preparation on a good file system
```
/tmp % datalad create top
/tmp % datalad create -d top top/sub
/tmp % echo 123 > top/sub/file
/tmp % datalad save -d top -r
```

Consumption on a crippled FS

```
% datalad install -s /tmp/top -r crippled 
[INFO   ] Cloning /tmp/top into '/tmp/crippled' 
[INFO   ]   Detected a filesystem without fifo support. 
[INFO   ]   Disabling ssh connection caching. 
[INFO   ]   Detected a crippled filesystem. 
[INFO   ]   Entering an adjusted branch where files are unlocked as this filesystem does not support locked files. 
[INFO   ] Switched to branch 'adjusted/master(unlocked)' 
install(ok): /tmp/crippled (dataset)
[INFO   ] Installing <Dataset path=/tmp/crippled> underneath /tmp/crippled recursively 
[INFO   ] Cloning /tmp/top/sub into '/tmp/crippled/sub' 
[INFO   ]   Detected a filesystem without fifo support. 
[INFO   ]   Disabling ssh connection caching. 
[INFO   ]   Detected a crippled filesystem. 
[INFO   ]   Entering an adjusted branch where files are unlocked as this filesystem does not support locked files. 
[INFO   ] Switched to branch 'adjusted/master(unlocked)' 
[INFO   ] Submodule HEAD got detached. Resetting branch adjusted/master(unlocked) to point to 61de7f3c. Original location was 3e574196 
action summary:
  get (ok: 1)
  install (ok: 1)

/tmp % datalad status -d crippled
#clean
/tmp % git -C crippled status
On branch adjusted/master(unlocked)
nothing to commit, working tree clean

```

Modified subdataset in order to save a new subdataset state in the parent:

```
/tmp % echo 234 > crippled/sub/file2
/tmp % datalad save -d crippled -r
add(ok): file2 (file)
save(ok): sub (dataset)
add(ok): sub (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  save (ok: 2)

/tmp % git -C crippled status
On branch adjusted/master(unlocked)
nothing to commit, working tree clean
% datalad status -d crippled -r
# clean
```

The result looks clean, but we commit the state in the adjusted branch in the parent:

```
/tmp % datalad -f json_pp status -d crippled crippled/sub | grep '"gitshasum"'
  "gitshasum": "4bd3db59f02dfcde835cbb7761f5ac24d8eeaf0a",
/tmp % git -C crippled/sub log -n1
commit 4bd3db59f02dfcde835cbb7761f5ac24d8eeaf0a (HEAD -> adjusted/master(unlocked))
Author: Michael Hanke <michael.hanke@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Oct 21 07:15:26 2019 +0200

    [DATALAD] Recorded changes
```

so when ever git annex will sync next (e.g. associated with a `push`), we end up dirty:

```
/tmp % git -C crippled/sub annex sync --no-push --no-pull
commit 
On branch adjusted/master(unlocked)
nothing to commit, working tree clean
ok
tmp % git -C crippled status
On branch adjusted/master(unlocked)
Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git checkout -- <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)

        modified:   sub (new commits)

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")
```
